intro: Odostemon paxii, commonly known as the Mexican daisy, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow flowers with white ray florets, typically blooming in summer. It is a perennial herb that grows up to 3 feet tall, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Odostemon paxii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
